fields.Name: DivorceCare
fields.Description: DivorceCare is a safe place where caring people come alongside you as you find healing from the pain of separation or divorce.  You will find helpful information and tools to walk through this life changing event.

fields.Name: GriefShare
fields.Description: GriefShare provides a safe place to join others who understand the emotions and pain of loss.  In this community you will find peace, comfort and the resources to move forward in life.  You don't have to suffer through grieving alone.

fields.Name: Freedom in Christ
fields.Description: Do you want to understand and live in your identity as a child of God?  To experience a lasting life-change and freedom?  This course does not focus on how to behave but on how to believe. You will learn to replace the lies you might believe about yourself with the truth of God's word. Develop spiritual maturity, resolve personal and spiritual conflicts, renew your mind and break free from negative thinking and unhelpful patterns of behavior.

fields.Name: Financial Peace University Spring Kickoff 2023
fields.Description: FPU is a life-changing 9-week course that includes practical lessons to help you eliminate debt, build wealth, give like never before, and much more! Each lesson, taught by Dave Ramsey and his team of financial experts, is based on biblical wisdom and common sense.

fields.Name: re|engage Spring 2023 Kickoff
fields.Description:
A better marriage starts here.re|engage is a program that offers hope to all marriages – whether you’re struggling to get along, feel more distant than ever before, or simply want to grow closer together as husband and wife. It is a community-driven experience with facilitator couples to help you. It's also a place where you'll be encouraged by the stories of different married couples who have experienced the life change God has brought to their marriages.
Our Spring 2023 semester kicks off on January 31! The semester starts by attending our Open Group Kickoff Sessions on January 31 and February 7 to learn more about re|engage and begin connecting with other married couples. During the kickoff participants will have the opportunity to commit to a Closed Group for the semester. Register below for the Open Group Kickoff and Childcare; registration will be open until January 31.
REGISTER

fields.Name: Holy Sexuality and the Gospel Conference
fields.Description:
As more confusion abounds on sexuality and gender, Dr. Christopher Yuan powerfully articulates that God's truth is crystal clear, not gray.Through the narrative of his personal transformation from an agnostic gay man to a Bible professor, and through his graduate level education in biblical languages, theology, and even health sciences, Dr. Yuan casts a compelling vision of not embracing our sexuality, but embracing Christ, thus shattering the paradigms of gay and straight and pointing us toward the biblical standard of holy sexuality.
Dr. Yuan is a highly sought-after expert whose book, Holy Sexuality and the Gospel, was named 2020 book of the year for social issues by Outreach Magazine. Christopher will be joined by his mother, Angela, as they minister together testifying to the transformative power of the gospel.
Register now for this two-day conference.
For more information and to register, please visit www.hcbc.com/conference

fields.Name: Holy Sexuality and the Gospel Conference
fields.Description:
As more confusion abounds on sexuality and gender, Dr. Christopher Yuan powerfully articulates that God's truth is crystal clear, not gray.Through the narrative of his personal transformation from an agnostic gay man to a Bible professor, and through his graduate level education in biblical languages, theology, and even health sciences, Dr. Yuan casts a compelling vision of not embracing our sexuality, but embracing Christ, thus shattering the paradigms of gay and straight and pointing us toward the biblical standard of holy sexuality.
Dr. Yuan is a highly sought-after expert whose book, Holy Sexuality and the Gospel, was named 2020 book of the year for social issues by Outreach Magazine. Christopher will be joined by his mother, Angela, as they minister together testifying to the transformative power of the gospel.
Save the date February 4 – 5, 2023, for this two-day conference.
For more information and to register, please visit www.hcbc.com/conference
Note: The Sunday portion of the conference will take place during our regular Sunday morning services.

fields.Name: Children's Baptism Class Leander
fields.Description:
Children's Baptism ClassAs your child grows and the truth of God’s love becomes more and more evident, they may begin to ask questions about what it means to be a Christian and why we get baptized. As a parent, God has given you the important role of nurturing your child's faith. And we want to come alongside of you in that journey.
If you believe your child is ready, we invite you to attend a Children’s Baptism class where you and your child will discover what it means to follow Jesus and the significance of baptism.
Registration is REQUIRED for both the class and baptism. You can register here: 
Baptism Class:
CHILDREN'S BAPTISM CLASS REGISTRATION
Baptism Registration Links:
LAKELINE CHILDREN'S BAPTISM REGISTRATION
LEANDER CHILDREN'S BAPTISM REGISTRATION
STEINER RANCH CHILDREN'S BAPTISM REGISTRATION
For more information, contact childrens@hcbc.com

fields.Name: God, Money, & Me
fields.Description: After the success of our Wills & Trusts Workshop held 11/6/22, we are happy to announce another workshop.  We will be covering how the resources we have been given relate to our faith in God. Held on February 15, 2023 from 10 – 11am at HCBC Lakeline Volunteer central (2nd floor).  Coffee and snacks will be provided.  For more information, send email to stewardship@hcbc.com.  To register, please RSVP.

fields.Name: Feed My Starving Children Mobile Pack Event
fields.Description:
Hill Country Bible Church will be hosting a Feed My Starving Children Mobile Pack event! Why a mobile packing event?  Food assistance is a vital component in the process of transitioning individuals, families and communities out of chronic hunger and poverty and into self-sufficiency. "Hunger is the world's biggest solvable problem." – World Food Programme. We believe that food is the foundation for all other progress. To a starving child, hope can only truly begin once a reliable source of nutritious food has been established. FMSC produces three special MannaPack™ meal formulas developed by food scientists to specifically stop malnutrition. We believe Jesus Christ has called us to feed the hungry and serve those in need. ·      Feeding children in our community and around the world
·      Partnering with local churches, businesses, schools, civic orgs.
·      Encouraging 1,500+ volunteers to donate 2 hours of their time
·      Packing 270,000 meals; that's enough to feed 740 kids a daily meal for an entire           year! 
·      Collecting food to restock the Reveal Resource Center (local community food               bank).Servant leaders enable us to do what we do, every day. We couldn’t do this work without YOU. Servant leaders pack all of the meals that the donations pay for.  It takes both packing and donating to feed the children!

fields.Name: ATX Weekend
fields.Description:
WHAT: ATX Weekend (Middle School)WHO: 6th, 7th, and 8th graders 
WHEN: Friday, February 24 - Saturday, February 25
Where: Austin Ridge Bible Church (Bee Cave), in homes, and other Austin locations
Cost: $100
ATX Student Weekend is a city-wide event with over 1,000 students expected to attend. Hill Country students and friends will join other churches in amazing worship times at Austin Ridge Bible Church (Bee Cave). Lunch and Dinner on Saturday will also happen at Austin Ridge along with other fun, afternoon activities.
This is an overnight event where students will spend Friday night with a Hill Country small group in host homes. This will give them a chance to hang out with just a few friends and talk about the Bible together. Small groups are based on which small group a student already attends or if you're not in a small group you can request a friend to be with. Anyone is welcome to come - you do not need to already be participating in a small group!
Students will participate in a serving project on Saturday with their small group. 
REGISTER HERE
